original_solution_mapping.L1: Mary started with 5 books and returned 3 so she had 5-3 = <<5-3=2>>2 books
original_solution_mapping.L2: She had 2 books and checked out 5 more books so she had 2+5 = <<2+5=7>>7 books
original_solution_mapping.L3: She now has 7 books but returned 2 so she has 7-2 = <<7-2=5>>5 books
original_solution_mapping.L4: She had 5 books and checked out 7 more books so she has 5+7 = <<5+7=12>>12 books checked out

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 7129.
    Returns: the number of books Mary currently has checked out of the library.
    """
    # L1
    initial_books = 5 # borrowed 5 books from the library
    returned_first_batch = 3 # returned 3 books
    books_after_first_return = initial_books - returned_first_batch

    # L2
    checked_out_first_new_batch = 5 # checked out 5 more books
    books_after_first_checkout = books_after_first_return + checked_out_first_new_batch

    # L3
    returned_second_batch = 2 # returned 2 of those books
    books_after_second_return = books_after_first_checkout - returned_second_batch

    # L4
    checked_out_second_new_batch = 7 # checked out 7 more books
    final_books = books_after_second_return + checked_out_second_new_batch

    # FA
    answer = final_books
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: Mary started with {initial_books} books and returned {returned_first_batch} so she had {initial_books}-{returned_first_batch} = <<{initial_books}-{returned_first_batch}={books_after_first_return}>>{books_after_first_return} books

She had {books_after_first_return} books and checked out {checked_out_first_new_batch} more books so she had {books_after_first_return}+{checked_out_first_new_batch} = <<{books_after_first_return}+{checked_out_first_new_batch}={books_after_first_checkout}>>{books_after_first_checkout} books

She now has {books_after_first_checkout} books but returned {returned_second_batch} so she has {books_after_first_checkout}-{returned_second_batch} = <<{books_after_first_checkout}-{returned_second_batch}={books_after_second_return}>>{books_after_second_return} books

She had {books_after_second_return} books and checked out {checked_out_second_new_batch} more books so she has {books_after_second_return}+{checked_out_second_new_batch} = <<{books_after_second_return}+{checked_out_second_new_batch}={final_books}>>{final_books} books checked out

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: Mary started with 5 books and returned 3 so she had 5-3 = <<5-3=2>>2 books
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: She had 2 books and checked out 5 more books so she had 2+5 = <<2+5=7>>7 books
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L3: She now has 5 books but returned 2 so she has 5-2 = <<5-2=3>>3 books
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L4: She had 3 books and checked out 7 more books so she has 3+7 = <<3+7=10>>10 books checked out

explanation: Incorrect operand. The variable 'initial_books' (value: 5) was used instead of 'books_after_first_checkout' (value: 7).
